message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This report analyzes data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys for the year 2020 to understand how COVID-19 has impacted the business environment in South Asia.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics", "COVID-19"]}, {"sentence": "The study uses data from the National Sample Survey Office (NSSO) and assesses the effect of infrastructure on employment creation over two decades in India.", "dataset": ["National Sample Survey Office (NSSO)"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed two waves of survey data from the Philippines Longitudinal Study of Aging (PLSA) to examine the factors affecting the social pension program enrollment and its impact on the well-being of older Filipinos.", "dataset": ["Philippines Longitudinal Study of Aging (PLSA)"], "topic": ["Social Protection", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We use a novel dataset that merges information on population demographics, schooling outcomes, and poverty indicators with a dataset on cellular network coverage in Madagascar to identify the geographical disparities in access to digital services.", "dataset": ["dataset on cellular network coverage", "poverty indicators"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "The paper utilizes a combination of satellite remote sensing data obtained from Copernicus Climate Change Service and crop yield data from US Department of Agriculture National Agricultural Statistics Service to analyze the effects of temperature shocks on crop yields in Nebraska.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service", "US Department of Agriculture National Agricultural Statistics Service"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We collected data from the World Development Indicators on gender disaggregated employment to examine the association between gender equality at work and economic growth across developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Gender", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We used two sources of data- the Indonesian Family Life Survey (IFLS) and Demographic Health Surveys (DHS) to investigate the effect of household air pollution from solid fuels on women's health in Indonesia.", "dataset": ["Indonesian Family Life Survey (IFLS)", "Demographic Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This study compiles a comprehensive dataset that combines CommTrade, African Development Bank, and UNIDO datasets to map the patterns of African exports and assess their structural characteristics.", "dataset": ["CommTrade", "African Development Bank", "UNIDO"], "topic": ["Regional Integration", "Trade", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Using panel data from firms in seven African countries, we examine how corporate social responsibility activities influence the financial performance of firms using regression analysis.", "dataset": ["panel data from firms in seven African countries"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We use a mix of satellite imagery, government statistics and household surveys to identify vulnerable populations and estimate losses associated with Damaging Hydro-Meteorological Phenomenon (DHMPs) in Papua New Guinea over the period 2010-2020.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery", "government statistics", "household surveys"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Poverty", "Climate Change"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "This report analyzes data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys for the year 2020 to understand how COVID-19 has impacted the business environment in South Asia.", "dataset": yields in Nebraska.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service", "US Department of Agriculture National Agricultural Statistics Service"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]},
